The George Brown College School of Media and Performing Arts offers a Performance program that provides intensive, career-oriented training in acting for theatre, television, and film. The conservatory-style curriculum covers voice, speech, movement, music and dance, improvisation, text analysis, scene studies, clowning, commedia dell’arte, and television and film technique, among other subjects. Students have the opportunity to participate in partnerships with Soulpepper Theatre Company, Tarragon Theatre, and Theatre by the Bay. In their final year, students are paired with a successful theatre practitioner for a mentorship program that continues for approximately a year after graduation. The competitive field of acting has a consistent demand for new talent, and George Brown College is recognized by ACTRA and UDA as an accredited training institution. Graduates can apply to join ACTRA as Apprentice members within one year, and may acquire 15 of the 30 credits required to become an active UDA member under certain conditions. The Performance program offers required courses in the first semester.
